title: Is account sharing still not allowed?
body: It's fairly common that someone is "just playing on a friends account" and I'm wondering if that's even worth reporting. only doing it this time because he was a jackass

replies.body:
Hey Summoner!

Here's the rundown on account sharing:

+ **Account sharing is only allowed between family members.** 

 Chapter III, Section B of the [Terms of Use](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) specifically states it allows account sharing between parents/legal guardians and _"minors"_. Otherwise, account sharing is against the rules.
 
 That doesn't mean you can share your log-in details with your family, that is [not allowed](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204214670-Shared-accounts). But if you log-in for them and allow them to play on your account, that is perfectly fine.

> _** As for your question:**_
>If that was a ranked game that they played, it's considered elo boosting and is 100% bannable. In fact I'd encourage you to send in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to report it.
> 
> If it was just bots or normals, you're welcome to report it, but to be honest **Riot** hasn't been known to be super strict on casual account sharing. To be clear though, casual account sharing is still against the Terms of Use (unless it's with parents).

Also, this is a borderline case of naming and shaming, but please try to cover up the names next time :)
Someone is probably going to say in this Post about **Naming and Shaming** I highly recommend you blur out the names of the Summoners speaking and please remove the Summoner's name from your message.
Screw the naming and shaming, players need to learn the rules and stick to them.
